intro: Cischweinfia platychila, commonly known as the broadleaf cischweinfia, is a tropical shrub native to regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are edible for both humans and animals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for hedges and garden landscapes.
